meanings.definition: Commit (an illegal, harmful, or immoral act)
meanings.sent1: The thief tried to perpetrate a robbery at the bank.
meanings.sent2: Criminals often perpetrate crimes under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent3: It would be foolish to perpetrate a prank on April Fools' Day.
meanings.sent4: His lies perpetrate a web of deceit that is hard to unravel.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan to perpetrate evil deeds was thwarted by the hero.

meanings.definition: Carry out (a harmful or illegal action)
meanings.sent1: The spy was ordered to perpetrate the sabotage mission.
meanings.sent2: The gang decided to perpetrate the vandalism late at night.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to perpetrate a daring escape from the house.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to perpetrate chaos throughout the city.
meanings.sent5: The chef will perpetrate the perfect dish for the special occasion.

meanings.definition: Be responsible for (a crime or wrongdoing)
meanings.sent1: The suspect denied any involvement in perpetrating the burglary.
meanings.sent2: The corrupt official was known to perpetrate acts of bribery.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy seemed to perpetrate mischief wherever it went.
meanings.sent4: The company's negligence perpetrate harm to the environment.
meanings.sent5: The dictator was known to perpetrate atrocities against his own people.
